subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Complex I Assembly and ROS Regulation Theory
Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of mtDNA mutations causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.
Emphasizes mtDNA mutations impairing respiratory complexes, especially Complex I, leading to aging.
Describes accumulation of mtDNA mutations causing respiratory chain defects and ROS increase.
Highlights mtDNA mutation accumulation and vicious cycle of ROS and mitochondrial dysfunction.
Focuses on mtDNA damage accumulation causing mitochondrial dysfunction and cellular senescence.
Describes mtDNA damage accumulation and respiratory chain dysfunction driving aging.
Focuses on mtDNA mutations impairing respiratory chain, supported by mtDNA mutator mouse model.
Discusses causal role of mtDNA mutations in aging with experimental evidence from mutator mice.
Emphasizes somatic mtDNA mutation accumulation causing bioenergetic decline and tissue dysfunction.
Describes mtDNA somatic mutations and ROS production impairing mitochondrial function and aging.
Links mitochondrial mutation rate and ROS to aging and longevity differences among species.
Focuses on clonal expansion of somatic mtDNA mutations impairing respiratory chain and aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS accumulation damaging mitochondria and reducing cell proliferative capacity.
Describes mitochondrial ROS generation causing oxidative damage and mitochondrial dysfunction.
Highlights mitochondrial ROS overproduction causing oxidative stress and stem cell dysfunction.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS causing mtDNA damage, respiratory impairment, and apoptosis.
Explains sex differences in mitochondrial ROS production affecting aging and lifespan.
Describes mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage accumulation, and antioxidant defenses.
Focuses on ROS-induced activation of mitochondrial apoptosis via Bak contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Complex I Assembly and ROS Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on complex I assembly equilibrium affecting ROS production and mitochondrial function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Complex I Assembly and ROS Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction including uncoupling and ROS effects on premature senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Complex I Assembly and ROS Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial uncoupling proteins reducing ROS production and modulating lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Complex I Assembly and ROS Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes reduced mitochondrial coupling and increased proton leak affecting energetics and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Complex I Assembly and ROS Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative phosphorylation inhibition causing mitochondrial dysfunction and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitophagy, mitochondrial fusion/fission, and quality control in mitochondrial aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitohormesis, mitochondrial dynamics, and quality control affecting aging and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Dynamics Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial iron homeostasis disruption affecting mitochondrial function and lifespan.
Describes ROS overgeneration causing oxidative damage and mitochondrial dysfunction in aging.
